basic.description: An in-depth examination of intellectual and cultural changes in continental Europe, 1750 to the present, organized around such themes as changing views of selfhood, rationality, emotions, irrationality, and technology. Movements that might be examined include the late Enlightenment, Romanticism, realism, and modernism. (Jointly with HIST-468.) Three hours; fall and winter. H. Mah.
basic.subject: HIST
basic.title: European Intellectual History
